byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and ERIC SCHMITT

abstract: Obama administration has expanded military campaign against Islamic State outside Iraq and Syria, authorizing attacks on new branch of militant group located in Afghanistan’s Tora Bora region, near Pakistan border.
snippet: The operations followed President Obama’s decision to expand the authority of American commanders to attack a new branch of the militant group in Afghanistan....

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

lead_paragraph: The operations followed President Obama’s decision to expand the authority of American commanders to attack a new branch of the militant group in Afghanistan.

headline.main: U.S. Broadens Fight Against ISIS With Attacks in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: With Strikes in Afghanistan, the U.S. Broadens Its Fight Against ISIS
